item.title: How to Get Metal Coat in Pokemon Legends Z-A (& Pokemon It Evolves)
item.description:
Metal Coat is an item in Pokemon Legends: Z-A that boosts the power of its holder's Steel-type moves. Additionally, Metal Coat plays an important role in the evolution of two Pokemon, and that is likely to be the reason that most players want to get their hands on it. For those players who would like to find Metal Coat in Pokemon Legends: Z-A , this guide is here to detail all its sources.

There is only one Metal Coat that can be obtained before rolling Pokemon Legends: Z-A 's credits, and it is not even available until very close to the end. As such, players should not expect to have both Steelix and Scizor in their squad until the post-game.

Metal Coat Locations in Pokemon Legends Z-A

Side Missions

There are two Side Missions that award one Metal Coat upon completion. The first is Side Mission 101: Steadfast as Steel , which becomes available during Main Mission 35 , near the end of Pokemon Legends: Z-A 's story. The second is Side Mission 114: A Feather from Skarmory , and players can initiate it after beating the game.

Vendor

After completing Pokemon Legends: Z-A , two new vendors will appear inside Racine Construction . These vendors sell a variety of items, and players can purchase Metal Coats from the one on the left for 4,980 Poke Coins each.

Infinite Z-A Royale

Once you beat the game, you will gain access to the Infinite Z-A Royale , which allows you to repeatedly exchange Challenger's Tickets for battles that award various items. One of the rewards that Pokemon Legends: Z-A players can receive upon winning an Infinite Z-A Royale match is a Metal Coat, though the chances of seeing that item are quite low.

Pokemon that Evolve with Metal Coat in Pokemon Legends Z-A

There are two Pokemon in Pokemon Legends: Z-A that can be made to evolve with a Metal Coat, and they are as follows:

  • Onix evolves into Steelix
  • Scyther evolves into Scizor

For the uninitiated, here is how to perform those evolutions:

  1. Select the Pokemon, in a Box or the Current Party, and choose the "give an item to hold" option.
  2. Select the Metal Coat from the Other Items tab.
  3. Navigate to the Menu (press X), and select Link Play.
  4. Choose Link Trade and then Faraway Players.
  5. Enter the Pokemon Legends: Z-A Link Code the community has agreed upon for these two Pokemon ( 0197-0197 for Onix and 0176-0176 for Scyther ).
  6. Once you connect with another player, select your Onix/Scyther to perform the trade and initiate the evolution.
58
4.7 /10

Pokemon Legends: Z-A

item.title: Should You Send Vox Relay to Westport, Space, or Fairfield in Outer Worlds 2?
item.description:
As you come towards the end of the 'The Saboteur of Paradise' main quest in The Outer Worlds 2 , you'll have the chance to redirect the Vox Relay from its current destination of Fairfield. Leaving the control panel as is will cause the relay to crash into the town, but there is a chance to divert its route and send it to either Westport or straight into space instead. The problem is, what's the best option? In this guide, I'll explain which you should choose and what happens if you send the Vox Relay to each of the three locations in The Outer Worlds 2 .

Should You Choose to Send the Vox Relay to Fairfield, Westport, or Space in The Outer Worlds 2?

The best destination to send the Vox Relay to in The Outer Worlds 2 is into space. By doing this, you'll prevent either of the two places on Paradise Island — Fairfield and Westport — from getting destroyed by the Vox Relay crashing into them.

This is the best option because it means that you'll have vendors and NPCs available in both Fairfield and Westport for you to interact with should you want to come back to Paradise Island once you're done with this main quest.

By saving Fairfield, you'll also prevent everyone there from dying (always a bonus). It also ensures that your reputation remains intact with Auntie's Choice for managing to save Fairfield, and your companion, Inez, won't hate and leave you. While you can't influence your reputation with the Protectorate, keeping Westport safe allows you to return there if you want to.

Sending the Vox Relay into space simply allows you to complete the main quest without making a decision that has a detrimental effect on Paradise Island itself, and Inez will be completely fine with it. However, it's worth noting that to do this, you'll need to have at least one Bypass Shunt, and have increased your Hacking skill to level four before interacting with the Vox Secure Connection Interface to send the Vox Relay into space.

If you don't have a bypass shunt or your 'Hack' skill at level four, you'll need to choose one of the two destinations. Given that Fairfield has more to offer you in terms of facilities and potential side quests, I'd recommend you send it to Westport. It's by no means the ideal solution, but the second-best option.

There is also an option of 'See if hitting it does anything' that requires the 'Lucky' trait to use. I've not been able to verify what happens if you select this, but as soon as I have any information, I'll update this post and let you know.

9 /10

The Outer Worlds 2

item.title: How to Get More Inhaler Charges in Outer Worlds 2
item.description:
During the introduction sequence at Horizon Point, players will be given the Medical Inhaler in Outer Worlds 2 . This item serves as your primary source of healing in Outer Worlds 2 , but after a few uses, you might notice that your Inhaler Charges are not recharging. Indeed, when you use your Inhaler, it will not automatically recharge its total number of uses.

Instead, to get more Inhaler Charges, Outer Worlds 2 players must look around the world for ways to get more Inhaler uses. There are three methods to get more Inhaler charges (really two, plus one that enhances another): using AutoDoc stations, picking up Drug items that increase Inhaler Charges by a percentage, and acquiring the Connoisseur perk.

Find an AutoDoc Station

AutoDocs Grant 2x Inhaler Charges in Outer Worlds 2

AutoDoc stations can be found throughout every location in Outer Worlds 2 . Using one will completely refresh your Health, remove any status effects, and give you 2x full Inhaler charges for free . Every AutoDoc station can only be used once to restore Inhaler Charges for free.

There is no max limit on how many Inhaler Charges you can have at once , so feel free to use these even if you are at (or close to) full Health. Though the AutoDoc will be consumed, you'll gain two heals to use later on.

Collect Items That Grant A Percentage of a Charge

Some Items Reward Inhaler Charge Percent Upon Pickup

Pay close attention to the item descriptions of objects you pick up as you explore the game, and you may notice that there are two main types of consumable pickups: food/drink and drugs .

Though most consumable items you find throughout Arcadia are food or drink items that exclusively restore Health, some are considered Drug items, which restore a portion of an Inhaler Charge instead .

These pickups can typically be found in interior areas, especially medical and science-related buildings.

These items are not added to your inventory and are immediately consumed for the Inhaler Charge value shown in the item description, typically anywhere from 8% to 32% or higher. When you go above 100% (as indicated by the bar below the Inhaler icon), you'll get a Charge !

Pick the Connoisseur Perk For Additional Charges

The Connoiseur Perk Increases Charge Amount Gained from Drugs

One of the best ways to get more Inhaler Charges in Outer Worlds 2 is to pick up the Connoisseur perk as early as possible . This perk has two effects: 25% increased Health restoration from food and drink, and 25% extra Inhaler Charge percentage from Drug items .

The best part of the Connoisseur perk is that it only requires you to invest one Skill Point into Medical . The earlier you get this perk, the more charges you will be able to build up over time.

This is the only standard perk that increases Inhaler Charge gain in Outer Worlds 2 , so if you find yourself using your Inhaler to heal, consider spending a Skill Point on your next level up (and a Perk Point at your next even level) to pick up this useful bonus.

The Outer Worlds 2
9 /10

October 29, 2025

item.title: What's the Max Level Cap in Outer Worlds 2?
item.description:
A key element of any RPG is leveling your character and building them out to suit the playstyle that you want. It's all part and parcel of the compelling gameplay loop that the genre is renowned for. With The Outer Worlds 2 this loop is still present, albeit on a slightly smaller scale, much like the length of the game. With so much controversy around the level cap of the first game, some players may be wondering if things have changed for the sequel. Here's what the max level cap is in The Outer Worlds 2 .

What Is the Max Level Cap in The Outer Worlds 2?

The max level cap in The Outer Worlds 2 is level 30. While this might come as a shock to some players, this falls largely in line with the level cap from the original game, which started out a lot lower before receiving a few boosts until its eventual 99 level cap in the Spacer's Choice edition.

The reason for the lower level cap? As is the case with the first game, The Outer Worlds 2 isn't some enormous, sprawling RPG. It's plenty big enough, but it's meant to be more of a compact adventure, and as such, developer Obsidian Entertainment has opted to keep the level cap in line with what players are likely to hit by exploring the majority of the content, without needing to endlessly grind out enemies for the sake of XP.

For players who do reach the max level cap in The Outer Worlds 2 , they'll be rewarded with the aptly-named 'Level 30' trophy and achievement.

Will The Outer Worlds 2's Max Level Cap Be Raised in the Future?

At the time of writing, Obsidian has yet to confirm any future plans for the title. However, if the game were to receive expansions like its predecessor did, it's possible that the level cap would be raised to give those who reach the max level on their character something to grind out in the new content. As noted, though, there is nothing confirmed at this stage, and so it remains to be seen whether we'll get post-launch content at all.

As soon as we hear anything, we'll be sure to update this post and let you know. Who knows, the level cap might be increased to level 99 at some point further down the line as part of any potential The Outer Worlds 2: Auntie's Choice edition.

9 /10

The Outer Worlds 2

item.title: How to Get & Evolve Snorunt in Pokemon Legends Z-A
item.description:
Snorunt is one of the few Pokemon with a split evolution line and two Mega Evolutions to boot. With Mega Froslass joining the roster of new Megas introduced in Pokemon Legends: Z-A . catching and training Snorunt is a must for every Trainer who wishes to get a decent Ice-Type Pokemon for their lineup.

Whether trainers wish to have Glalie or Froslass (and their respective Mega Evolutions) in their teams, they will find all the information on how to catch, train, and evolve Snorunt in this guide.

How to Find Snorunt in Pokemon Legends: Z-A

Snorunt is one of those Pokemon that trainers would not want to miss in Pokemon Legends Z-A, and if they want to add one to their team, traveling to Wild Zone 12 is what they must do. This area with Ice-type Wild Pokemon becomes available after beating Canari and reaching E-Rank, during Main Mission 14.

If players catch a Female Snorunt , it will eventually evolve into Froslass , and if they catch a Male Snorunt , it will evolve into Glalie . To complete the Pokedex in Legends Z-A , players need both, so even if they are not going to train them, they should pick one from each gender.

How to Evolve Snorunt in Pokemon Legends Z-A

As mentioned before, Snorunt has split evolution lines depending on its gender (like Kirlia , which can evolve into Gardevoir / Gallade ), and to get Snorunt to evolve into Glalie, players need to simply make it reach level 42 , then open the menu (X) and hit Evolve over Snorunt's thumbnail.

Now, for the Female Snorunt to evolve into Froslass, players need to get a special evolution stone called Dawn Stone, which can be easily obtained at the Stone Emporium in Lumiose, or, if players are lucky, found lying around while exploring.

Snorunt

Glalie

Froslass

But that's not the end of the line for either Glalie or Froslass, which have yet another power boost thanks to Mega Evolution. Players can find the Mega Stone needed to evolve Glalie into Mega Glalie called Glalitite by completing Main Mission 10, and then purchasing the stone for 240 Mega Shards at Quasartico INC .

Now, for the Froslastite needed to evolve Froslass into Mega Froslass, players need to complete Main Mission Nº27: A Rogue Mega Froslass, and after beating this Pokemon in battle, they will receive the Mega Stone.

Glalie is a decent pure Ice-type Pokemon altogether, with a BST of 480 evenly distributed (which is extremely rare to find in any Pokemon) and when evolving into Mega Glalie, this BST turns into 580, but it becomes focused on Glalie's Speed, Special Attack, and Attack, turning it into a decent Hybrid Ice-type attacker.

Froslass, on the other hand, is an Ice/Ghost-type , a unique combination among all the possible choices for trainers in Pokemon Legends Z-A. It has the same BST as Glalie (480) , but its distribution is slightly different, having less HP, Def, and Sp. Def , but more Speed .

The same pattern repeats when Froslass Mega Evolves, raising only three of its Base Stat values (Sp. Atk: 80 → 140, Sp. Def 70 → 100, Speed 110 → 120), reaching a BST of 580 . These increased values turn Mega Froslass into the definitive choice for players wanting a decent Ice-type attacker, which can also gain an advantage against Fighting-type thanks to its Ghost sub-typing.
